name: Wristkey
description: A free and open-source 2FA app for smartwatches.
readme_summary: Wristkey is a free and open-source Two-Factor Authentication (2FA) app designed for Wear OS smartwatches, allowing users to generate OTPs directly from their wrist. It also supports phone usage and offers secure local storage and encrypted transfers.
key_features: Standalone Wear OS app (no phone pairing required)
Imports from Aegis Authenticator, andOTP, and Bitwarden
Supports Time-based One-Time Passwords (TOTP) and Counter-based One-Time Passwords (HOTP)
primary_use_case: To provide users with a convenient and secure way to manage and generate Two-Factor Authentication (2FA) codes directly from their smartwatch.
cover_image_prompt: A stylized smartwatch on a wrist, acting as a secure vault. The watch face displays a glowing, abstract representation of a rapidly changing digital key. From the watch, streams of secure, encrypted data particles flow outwards, transforming into small, distinct icons representing various online services (like email, social media, banking). In the background, a subtle, abstract digital network connects these services, emphasizing secure access. The overall mood is one of security and convenience, with a clean, modern aesthetic. The art style should be a 3D isometric illustration with a focus on glowing digital elements and clear iconography, highlighting the seamless transfer of secure codes from the watch to online accounts.

name: LiftShift
description: Convert your workout logs from Hevy, Strong, Lyfta, etc.,  into actionable insights with interactive muscle heatmaps, calendar filtering, shareable progress cards, plateau detection, detailed exercise and muscle analysis for FREE!
readme_summary: LiftShift is a free, open-source web application that converts workout logs from various fitness apps (like Hevy and Strong) into actionable insights. It provides interactive muscle heatmaps, calendar filtering, progress cards, plateau detection, and detailed exercise analysis.
primary_use_case: To provide users with a centralized platform to analyze their workout data from different fitness tracking apps, offering deeper insights and visualization of their progress.
cover_image_prompt: A wise old librarian meticulously organizing a chaotic library of scattered workout journals and digital logs. The librarian is using a magical magnifying glass that, when held over a journal, projects a vibrant, interactive muscle heatmap onto a nearby wall. Beside the librarian, a digital dashboard displays clear charts and progress metrics, with a small, subtle 'LiftShift' logo on its screen. The background shows shelves filled with diverse fitness app icons. The scene is bathed in warm, analytical lighting, rendered in a clean, 3D isometric illustration style with a focus on clarity and intuitive data representation.

name: RedCoffee
description: RedCoffee is a Python Based CLI Tool that generates PDF Reports for analysis done using SonarQube Community Edition
readme_summary: RedCoffee is a Python-based command-line interface (CLI) tool designed to generate PDF reports from SonarQube Community Edition analysis data. It addresses the lack of native PDF export functionality in the community edition, making it easier to share and review code quality metrics.
key_features: Generates PDF reports from SonarQube analysis data
Includes GitHub Actions for CI/CD (Unit Tests, MkDocs deployment)
Integrates with IPInfo for GeoLocation and Sentry for error logging
Provides local setup instructions using Docker Compose for SonarQube and Postgres
Organized project structure with dedicated modules for core functionality, reporting, and utilities
primary_use_case: To automate the generation of PDF reports from SonarQube Community Edition analysis, facilitating easier sharing and review of code quality metrics.
cover_image_prompt: A diligent librarian meticulously organizing and binding stacks of complex code scrolls into beautifully crafted, easily readable PDF books. The librarian is using a magical magnifying glass that highlights key quality metrics (like bug icons, code coverage percentages) from the scrolls. The background shows a dimly lit, organized archive with subtle glowing data streams flowing from the scrolls to the books. The 'RedCoffee' logo is subtly embossed on the spine of one of the finished PDF books. The scene is rendered in a warm, inviting digital painting style with clear outlines and a focus on the transformation from raw data to a polished report.

name: kodus-ai
description: AI code reviews â€” just like your senior dev would do.
readme_summary: Kodus AI is an open-source AI agent designed to perform code reviews, mimicking the thoroughness of a senior developer. It integrates with Git workflows to learn codebase specifics and team standards, providing automated, context-aware feedback on pull requests to improve code quality, catch bugs, and enforce best practices.
primary_use_case: Automated, intelligent code reviews integrated into Git workflows to improve code quality and developer productivity.
cover_image_prompt: A wise, friendly robot librarian meticulously organizing and annotating stacks of code scrolls in a futuristic library. The robot is using a glowing magnifying glass to examine each scroll, highlighting potential errors with soft red light and suggesting improvements with gentle blue light. Input scrolls are chaotic and jumbled, while output scrolls are neatly arranged and annotated with clear, concise feedback. Subtle digital particles representing code flow around the robot. The repository name 'Kodus AI' is subtly etched on a nearby shelf. The scene is bathed in warm, inviting light, rendered in a 3D isometric illustration style with clean lines and a focus on clarity.

name: mussel
readme_summary: Mussel is an interpreted, dynamically typed programming language written in Rust, designed for simplicity, readability, and powerful expression evaluation. It offers features like data types, functions, control flow, and a standard library, aiming for a balance between Rust's safety and speed with Python's ease of use.
key_features: Supports data types, variable bindings, functions, closures
High execution speed and security due to Rust interpreter
primary_use_case: A general-purpose interpreted programming language for scripting, rapid prototyping, and learning programming concepts, offering a blend of performance and ease of use.
cover_image_prompt: A friendly, stylized robot holding a blueprint, meticulously assembling intricate gears and circuits. The robot is on a clean, minimalist workbench. Input materials are simple, raw blocks of code, while the output is a smoothly running, glowing contraption representing a functional program. Subtle digital particles flow from the blueprint to the robot's hands, and small, abstract UI elements suggesting code editors are visible in the background. The overall mood is one of creation and efficiency. The scene should be rendered in a 3D isometric illustration style with a bright, optimistic color palette, emphasizing clarity and the process of building something functional from simple parts. The name 'Mussel' is subtly etched onto the robot's chassis.
